channel.title: AI4CS Workshop on ISP - Image and Signal Processing group
channel.description: Recent content in AI4CS Workshop on ISP - Image and Signal Processing group

item.title: Session 7 (S7) – Machine learning (foundation models, causality)
item.description: About Event Presentations: Two talks (20+10 min each). Breakout Discussions: Topics entered and voted using Slido. Groups form based on the most-voted topics, moderated by the proposer. A note-taker is assigned for each group.

item.title: Session 8 (S8) – Conclusions and Wrap-up
item.description: About Event Presentation of breakout session outcomes. Consolidated discussion on common themes of complexity and possible solutions across sessions. Farewell and closing remarks.

item.title: Session 3 (S3) – Earth-Land Systems
item.description: About Event Presentations: Two talks (20+10 min each). Breakout Discussions (1 hour): Topics entered and voted using Slido. Groups form based on the most-voted topics, moderated by the proposer. A note-taker is assigned for each group.

item.title: Session 4 (S4) – Socio-Environmental Systems
item.description: About Event Presentations: Two talks (20+10 min each). Breakout Discussions: Topics entered and voted using Slido. |Groups form based on the most-voted topics, moderated by the proposer. A note-taker is assigned for each group.

item.title: Session 5 (S5) – Vision Neuroscience
item.description: About Event Presentations: Two talks (20+10 min each).

item.title: Session 6 (S6) – Vision Image Processing
item.description: About Event Presentations: Tow talks (20+10 min each). Moderated Q&A for both vision sessions

item.title: Introduction to AI4CS and workshop goals
item.description: About Event This session will provide an overview of AI4CS, including its objectives and key challenges: Overview of AI4CS, objectives, and key challenges. Explanation of workshop structure, session formats, and expected outcomes.

item.description: About Event Presentations: Two talks (20+10 min each).

item.title: Session 2 (S3) – Earth-Land Systems
